pageTextData.subTitle: Modelling
pageTextData.description: The model of car I chose is a 1942 Dodge WC-53 because of its simplistic structure and interesting shapes. A virtual studio was set up using front, side and top elevations to work from. The main body and chassis were modelled in half with a symmetry modifier applied to complete the shape. Once the main components and proportions were blocked in I added more mesh iterations to smooth off the shape, keeping the mesh and edge loops tidy. Extra geometry details were added and all model UV's flattened out.

pageTextData.subTitle: Cameras and Lights
pageTextData.description: For the scanline renderer a simple light set up was applied. Using standard direct lights in 3D Studio Max 2017, a main ‘sun’, a low lit ‘sky’ and ‘fill’  lights are added. This provided a simple daytime lighting effect. The main direct light (sun) has ray traced shadows turned on. The camera is a ‘Physical’ camera with a target centred to the middle of the model. This set up adequately shows the model off in a pleasing and natural way.

pageTextData.subTitle: Animation
pageTextData.description: All components of the vehicle are constrained to a dummy object. This acted as a master positioner for the model. All movable wheels are constrained to a dummy object which in turn is constrained to the master dummy. Each wheel is wired to the main dummy. The local  X movement of the master dummy rotates the wheels accordingly. The front wheels are wired to the steering wheel to turn them for cornering. The body is wired similarly so it banks during cornering. For simplicity the master dummy is constrained to a path. As the vehicle moves along the path the wheels spin automatically. Animating the steering wheel on the corners simulates steering and suspension.

pageTextData.subTitle: Exporting to VRML97 and Rendering in X3D
pageTextData.description: An export scene is created in 3D Studio Max 2017 containing the model, camera, lights and a ‘Nav info’ helper object used by the X3D renderer. The whole scene is exported as a VRML97 file and converted into an X3D file so the X3D renderer can read the scene data. The materials all use the same diffuse colour map. Specular is added to all shiny surfaces which is shown in the X3D renderer, but the bump map doesn’t seem to render in the X3D renderer.

pageTextData.subTitle: Photorealistic Rendering
pageTextData.description: For the ‘Mental Ray’ renderer, a daylight system is set up automatically creating a sun and a sky light for the scene. An additional a standard skylight is added for ambient occlusion, a backplate image and a sphere version of the backplate image are added to the environment. The sphere background map used in reflections helps blend the foreground model into the background. This map is used in the skylight to further blend the model into the backplate. Shadow from the model is added using a shadow matte material. The materials on the model are all Arch and Design materials which in conjunction with the daylight and sky system produce very natural looking surfaces and shadowing.
